item.title: Erin add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The hottest places in hell are reserved for those who, in times of great moral crisis, maintain their neutrality." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Erin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Anyway—because we are readers, we don't have to wait for some communications executive to decide what we should think about next—and how we should think about it. We can fill our heads with anything from aardvarks to zucchinis—at any time of night or day." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anthony Burgess
item.description: "If you write fiction you are, in a sense, corrupted. There's a tremendous corruptibility for the fiction writer because you're dealing mainly with sex and violence. These remain the basic themes, they're the basic themes of Shakespeare whether you like it or not." -- Anthony Burgess

item.title: Erin add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "In the face of impossible odds, people who love this country can change it." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Erin add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "We are the change we have been waiting for." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Erin add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "In the unlikely story that is America, there has never been anything false about hope." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Erin add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "A good compromise, a good piece of legislation, is like a good sentence or a good piece of music. Everybody can recognize it. They say, 'Huh. It works. It makes sense." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anita Diamant
item.description: "I wanted to cry, but I realized that I was too old for that. I would be a woman soon and I would have to learn how to live with a divided heart." -- Anita Diamant

item.title: Erin add a quote by Anita Diamant
item.description: "If you want to understand any woman you must first ask about her mother and then listen carefully. Stories about food show a strong connection. Wistful silences demonstrate unfinished business. The more a daughter knows about the details of her mother's life - without flinching or whining - the stronger the daughter." -- Anita Diamant

item.title: Erin add a quote by Studs Terkel
item.description: "I always love to quote Albert Einstein because nobody dares contradict him." -- Studs Terkel
